data.name: Validate Content-Type Header
data.description:
# Validate Content-Type Header

## Task

Given an [http response object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Response), validate that is has a valid JavaScript [Content-Type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Type) header. 
If a valid Content-Type header is present, return `true`. Otherwise return `false`.

There are many non standard headers names so for our purposes we will look for the following patterns.

```
text/javascript
text/ecmascript
application/javascript
application/ecmascript
```
As per the HTTP standard, headers are not case sensitive so ignore case. Also by convention, this header can aslo contain encoding or other information following a semicolon followed by a space. So the following should be considered valid.

```
text/javascript; charset=utf-8
text/javascript; somestuff you can ignore
```
Also note that the Content-Type header is completely optional and may be missing entirely from the http response. A missing Content-Type header is not considered valid. The input object will always be a valid response object that contains a valid [headers](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Headers) object.
